Package dtu.ws.fastmoney.persistency

Interface Repository

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InMemoryRepository
    public interface Repository
    Represents an abstraction to access a database. It provides operations to create, read, delete, and update accounts and to create transactions used with accounts. Databases for the bank implement the Repository interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void createAccount​(Account a)
      Create a new account in the database.
      void createAccountTransaction​(Transaction t)
      Create a transaction record in the database.

      Delete the account with the given account number.

      Executes a set of commands in the context of a database transaction.

      Account readAccountByCpr​(java.lang.String cpr)

      Update the records for a given account in the database.

    • Method Detail

      • createAccount

        void createAccount​(Account a)
        Create a new account in the database.
        Parameters:
        a - the account to be created

      • readAccount

        Account readAccount​(java.lang.String id)
        Parameters:
        id - the account number
        Returns:
        the account for the given account number

      • deleteAccount

        void deleteAccount​(java.lang.String id)
        Delete the account with the given account number.
        Parameters:
        id - the account number

      • updateAccount

        void updateAccount​(Account a)
        Update the records for a given account in the database.
        Parameters:
        a - the account with the new information

      • createAccountTransaction

        void createAccountTransaction​(Transaction t)
        Create a transaction record in the database.
        Parameters:
        t - the transaction

      • readAccountByCpr

        Account readAccountByCpr​(java.lang.String cpr)
        Parameters:
        cpr - the CPR number of the user owning the account
        Returns:
        the account object for the user with a given CPR number

      • readAccounts

        java.util.List<Account> readAccounts()
        Returns:
        a list of all accounts in the database

      • executeInTransaction

        void executeInTransaction​(UnitFunction f)
                   throws BankServiceException
        Executes a set of commands in the context of a database transaction. This can be used as follows repo.executeInTransaction(() -> {...;});
        Parameters:
        f - is an instance of class UnitFunction representing a method with no arguments and no return value
        Throws:
        BankServiceException - when the transaction fails after the transaction was rolled back
